channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown bushes & trees needs to be cut down by the dyke, 15th August
item.description:
Resident reporting there is overgrown hedges, bushes & trees that need to be cut down all this has overgrown onto the pavement and is a danger for public & wheelchair users and prams as they have to step into the road to walk up. Please could someone look into this asap. It was last cut back about 6 months ago.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fendyke Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rough sleeper on Common, 15th August
item.description:
There has been a man rough sleeping on the Common for several days which must be very unsafe for him in terms of his health and his safety. Does the Council have any agency that can check on him and make sure he is getting the proper attention he needs please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): School Road, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sandwich-board in the middle of corner pavement at Graces 242 High Street Beckenham, 15th August
item.description:
I have given details of the obstruction to the pavement outside Graces 242 High Street. I do not know why your system has suddenly brought up this page about pothole???

item.title: Littered and has overgrown with weeds, 15th August
item.description:
The communal green area in front of the Highline building at 10 Steedman Street London SE17 3AF is currently littered and has overgrown with weeds. Would it be possible to arrange for it to be cleaned up? This has been like this one year.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Unit 103, Steedman Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead pigeons, 4th time reported, 15th August
item.description:
There is a dead pigeon on top of the substation. It's now rotting. Reported on 10th & again 11th July both time case closed as resolved. It wasn't. I also called Bexley council following this and was assured "someone would clear it this week", that was almost a month ago. There are also multiple sets of number plates discarded up there. Please clear this up and do not close the report as fixed unless it's actually been done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Avenue, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Delivery cars occupying parking bays with no permits, 15th August
item.description:
Regular delivery cars without parking permits picking from the food outlet on this street are taking up parking bays along the street for very long periods during the day, leaving no bays for the local residents. They also park illegally on the single yellow lines causing congestion during the day.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pelier Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Request for a couple of extra bins and to ensure bins emptied at the end of the day, 15th August
item.description:
Walking through queens gardens this morning it was clear all the bins had not been emptied last night. This meant foxes and squirrels had pulled the waste out. There is also a lack of bins in the middle of the park. Can a bin in the middle be installed and the bins emptied at the end of day? Itâ€™s been like this a few times now

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lownds Court, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: What is the mayor of Hackney doing about all these road closures due to works the mayor of Hackney needs to open alternative roads the ease the traffic flow. What is the mayor of Hackney doing about Chatsworth Rd, London new road ltn closure causing chaos on surrounding streets and even for the local homerton hospital ambulances struggling to get emergency patients to the hospital due to the mayor's ultra low street sign being enforced today hac01, 15th August

item.title: Over hanging once again and can't see when parking your vehicles, 15th August
item.description:
Trees are over hanging once again, they need to cut it right back, you catch the top of your vehicles on it, they cut it up but not back, the branches constantly drop into the road, so your forever having to get out your cars, vans to remove there tree branches, it's not letting you walk along the pavements and you can not park cars and vans correctly
